column4: How can I reload the last Ubuntu update? I deleted something from the update which is needed.
How can I reload the last Ubuntu update? I deleted something from the update which is needed.
Can anyone help me...How can I reinstall last updates?
which are you using, chrome or chromium? and can you pastebin the error you're getting from it?
you still didn't give me the info i asked for which is kinda necessary to troubleshoot your issue
you should never delete files outside of your home directory unless you know 110% what you're doing. just for future reference. ;-)
ahh, ok... well that's good then.
i would probably just completely remove chromium and chrome in software center, then install them again. that should bring back in whatever dependencies you got rid of.
erm, you (or the user management gui) must have accidentally removed you from the sudo group in the process
to see if a package is installed: "apt-cache policy <package>" (that shows the availble versions and which, if any, are installed) or "dpkg --get-selections | grep <package>"
now *there* is some useful output. which release of ubuntu are you on?
can you pastebin the output from this command: dpkg --get-selections | grep flash

have you tried moving your chrome user data folder and seeing how it does with a clean profile? (you should have a folder like ~/.chrome, ~/.google/chrome, ~/.config/chrome or ~/.config/google/chrome - try renaming it to chrome-OLD)
if you already tried deleting it and got the same problem on a clean chrome profile, then no
just so people don't misunderstand you (as i did), you may want to start saying "uninstalled" instead of "deleted" ;)
sorry, but i'm pretty much at a loss... you might post your issue on the forums (with all relevant details) and see if anyone there can figure out what's wrong
